channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024060960
item.description:
Report X-2024060960

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: WILLINGTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: The box is has a limited quantity diamond that they covered over with the barcode. This is an undeclared hazmat. The box is also leaking powder. The top of the fire extinguisher is dented and leaked.

item.title: Report X-2024060487
item.description:
Report X-2024060487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was observed to be leaking prior to loading into delivery van. Package was removed from workflow and brought to QA cage for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. Caps from both 1-gal bottles were loose, leaked. Caps were not secured w/tape or by other means. Liquids not bagged to prevent release. Relatively tall box unlikely to remain upright during transportation and sort.

item.title: Report E-2024060246
item.description:
Report E-2024060246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: SOUTHINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight forklift operator had the forkblades on the forklift too high and as a result punctured one of the boxes when they went to pick up the freight consequently puncturing an inner container contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled mater was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured box and inner container.
